location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.347 of 1853 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter relates to the recent emancipation of a female Somalian at Muscat, who had been kidnapped and sold into slavery at Soor [Sur]. Kemball writes that he has written to the authorities in Muscat, with a view to repatriating the woman and her brother, with the assistance of the Political Agent at Aden.There is a single enclosure with Kemball's letter, a translation of a letter (folios 391v-92) from the British Agent at Muscat to Kemball, dated 2 November 1853, in which the Agent reports the circumstances of the kidnapped woman's brother requesting his help in retrieving his sister in Muscat, and the girl's account of how she was kidnapped from her own country by men from Sur.
